</EFX_FINANCIAL_DATA>
<EFX_MANAGEMENTS_DISCUSSION>
<A NAME="FIS_MANAGEMENTS_DISCUSSION"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2223239Z10-K_HTM_DK15401_ITEM_7__MANAGEMENT_S_DISCUSSIO__ITE03668">
</A>
<A NAME="A2223239Z10-K_HTM_TOC_DK15401_1">
</A>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Item&nbsp;7.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;MANAGEMENT'S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Business Overview
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Activision Blizzard,&nbsp;Inc. is a leading global developer and publisher of interactive entertainment. The terms "Activision
	Blizzard," the "Company," "we," "us," and "our" are used to refer collectively to Activision Blizzard,&nbsp;Inc. and its subsidiaries.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	The Business Combination and Share Repurchase
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Activision,&nbsp;Inc. was originally incorporated in California in 1979 and was reincorporated in Delaware in December 1992.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On
	July&nbsp;9, 2008, a business combination (the "Business Combination") by and among Activision,&nbsp;Inc., Sego Merger Corporation, a wholly-owned subsidiary of
	Activision,&nbsp;Inc., Vivendi&nbsp;S.A. ("Vivendi"), VGAC&nbsp;LLC, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Vivendi , and Vivendi Games,&nbsp;Inc. ("Vivendi Games"), a wholly-owned subsidiary of
	VGAC&nbsp;LLC, was consummated. As a result of the consummation of the Business Combination, Activision,&nbsp;Inc. was renamed Activision Blizzard,&nbsp;Inc. and Vivendi became a majority
	shareholder of Activision Blizzard. Activision Blizzard is a public company traded on the NASDAQ under the ticker symbol "ATVI."
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On
	October&nbsp;11, 2013, we repurchased approximately 429&nbsp;million shares of our common stock, pursuant to a stock purchase agreement (the "Stock Purchase Agreement") we entered
	into on July&nbsp;25, 2013, with Vivendi and ASAC II&nbsp;LP ("ASAC"), an exempted limited partnership established under the laws of the Cayman Islands, acting by its general partner, ASAC
	II&nbsp;LLC. Pursuant to the terms of the Stock Purchase Agreement, we acquired all of the capital stock of Amber Holding Subsidiary&nbsp;Co., a Delaware corporation and wholly-owned subsidiary of
	Vivendi ("New VH"), which was the direct owner of approximately 429&nbsp;million shares of our common stock, for a cash payment of $5.83&nbsp;billion, or $13.60 per share, before taking into
	account the benefit to the Company of certain tax attributes of New VH assumed in the transaction (collectively, the "Purchase Transaction"). Refer to Note&nbsp;12 of the Notes to Consolidated
	Financial Statements for further information regarding the financing of the Purchase Transaction, and below in Other Liquidity and Capital Resources for additional information.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Immediately
	following the completion of the Purchase Transaction, Vivendi sold ASAC 172&nbsp;million shares of Activision Blizzard's common stock, pursuant to the Stock Purchase
	Agreement, for a cash payment of $2.34&nbsp;billion, or $13.60 per share.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On
	May&nbsp;28, 2014, Vivendi sold approximately 41&nbsp;million shares, or approximately 50% of its then-current holdings, of our common stock in a registered public offering.
	Vivendi received proceeds of approximately $850&nbsp;million from that sale; we did not receive any proceeds. Vivendi currently owns approximately 41&nbsp;million shares of our common stock.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
	of December&nbsp;31, 2014, we had approximately 722&nbsp;million shares of common stock issued and outstanding. At that date, (i)&nbsp;Vivendi held 41&nbsp;million shares, or
	approximately 6% of the outstanding shares of our common stock, (ii)&nbsp;ASAC held 172&nbsp;million shares, or approximately 24% of the outstanding shares of our common stock, and
	(iii)&nbsp;our other stockholders held approximately 70% of the outstanding shares of our common stock.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	47
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=47,EFW="2223239",CP="ACTIVISION BLIZZARD, INC.",DN="1",CHK=573522,FOLIO='47',FILE='DISK108:[15ZAO1.15ZAO15401]DK15401A.;15',USER='JFUSS',CD='26-FEB-2015;13:41' -->
<A NAME="A2223239Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DK15401_1_48">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2223239Z10-K_HTM_BG15401A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Operating Segments
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Based upon our organizational structure, we conduct our business through three operating segments as follows:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	(i) Activision Publishing,&nbsp;Inc.
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Activision Publishing,&nbsp;Inc. ("Activision") is a leading international developer and publisher of interactive software products
	and content. Activision delivers content to a broad range of gamers, ranging from children to adults, and from core gamers to mass-market consumers to "value" buyers seeking budget-priced software, in
	a variety of geographies. Activision develops games based on internally-developed properties, including games in the Call of Duty&reg; and Skylanders&reg; franchises, and to a lesser
	extent, based on licensed intellectual properties. Additionally, we have established a long-term alliance with Bungie to publish its game universe,
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Destiny
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&reg;, which was released on September&nbsp;9,
	2014. Activision sells games through both retail and digital online channels. Activision
	currently offers games that operate on the Microsoft Corporation ("Microsoft") Xbox One ("Xbox&nbsp;One") and Xbox&nbsp;360 ("Xbox&nbsp;360"), Nintendo&nbsp;Co.&nbsp;Ltd. ("Nintendo") Wii U
	("Wii U") and Wii ("Wii"), and Sony Computer Entertainment,&nbsp;Inc. ("Sony") PlayStation 4 ("PS4") and PlayStation 3 ("PS3") console systems (Xbox One, Wii U, and PS4 are collectively referred to
	as "next-generation"; Xbox&nbsp;360, Wii, and PS3 are collectively referred to as "prior-generation"); the personal&nbsp;computer ("PC"); the Nintendo 3DS, Nintendo Dual Screen, and Sony
	PlayStation Vita handheld game systems; and mobile and tablet devices.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	(ii) Blizzard Entertainment,&nbsp;Inc.
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Blizzard Entertainment,&nbsp;Inc. ("Blizzard") is a leader in the subscription-based massively multi-player online role-playing game
	("MMORPG") category in terms of both subscriber base and revenues generated through its World of Warcraft
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	&reg;
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	franchise, which it develops,
	hosts and supports. Blizzard also develops, markets, and sells role-playing action and strategy games for the PC, console, mobile and tablet platforms, including games in the multiple-award winning
	Diablo&reg;, StarCraft&reg;, and Hearthstone&reg;: Heroes of Warcraft&#153; franchises. In addition, Blizzard maintains a proprietary online game-related service,
	Battle.net
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	&reg;
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	. Blizzard distributes its products and generates revenues worldwide through various means, including: subscriptions; sales of
	prepaid subscription cards; value-added services, such as in-game purchases and services; retail sales of physical "boxed" products; online download sales of PC products; purchases and downloads via
	third-party console, mobile and tablet platforms; and licensing of software to third-party or related-party companies that distribute
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	World of Warcraft
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	,
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Diablo III
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	and
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	StarCraft II
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	products. In addition, Blizzard is the creator of
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Heroes of the Storm&#153;
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, a new free-to-play online hero brawler that is currently in closed beta testing.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	(iii) Activision Blizzard Distribution
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our distribution segment ("Distribution") consists of operations in Europe that provide warehousing, logistical and sales distribution
	services to third-party publishers of interactive entertainment software, our own publishing operations, and manufacturers of interactive entertainment hardware.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Business Results and Highlights
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In 2014, Activision Blizzard's consolidated net revenues were $4.4&nbsp;billion and consolidated operating income was
	$1.2&nbsp;billion, as compared to consolidated net revenues of $4.6&nbsp;billion and consolidated operating income of $1.4&nbsp;billion in 2013. Despite lower net revenues and operating income
	in 2014, as compared to 2013, we generated comparable cash flows from operating activities of approximately $1.3&nbsp;billion in both 2014 and 2013.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	48
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=48,EFW="2223239",CP="ACTIVISION BLIZZARD, INC.",DN="1",CHK=412572,FOLIO='48',FILE='DISK108:[15ZAO1.15ZAO15401]DK15401A.;15',USER='JFUSS',CD='26-FEB-2015;13:41' -->
<A NAME="A2223239Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DK15401_1_49">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2223239Z10-K_HTM_BG15401A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
	a result of the Purchase Transaction on October&nbsp;11, 2013, we incurred interest and amortization expenses related to the Term Loan and Notes of $208&nbsp;million in 2014 (in
	each case, as defined below), which reflects a full year of interest expense, as compared to a partial year of interest and amortization expenses of $58&nbsp;million in 2013. The increase in
	interest and amortization expenses contributed to a lower consolidated net income of $835&nbsp;million in 2014, as compared to $1&nbsp;billion in 2013. Despite lower net income, our diluted
	earnings per common share increased from $0.95 in 2013 to $1.13 in 2014. The increase was partially due to the reduction in our common shares outstanding by approximately 429&nbsp;million shares, as
	a result of the Purchase Transaction. Our weighted-average share count reflected this reduction in shares outstanding for all of 2014, as compared to 2013, when the weighted-average share count
	reflected the reduction for only a portion of the year.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;According
	to The NPD Group with respect to North America, GfK Chart-Track with respect to Europe, and Activision Blizzard internal estimates, including toys and accessories, during
	2014:
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	In North America and Europe combined, Activision was the #1 publisher and had three of the top five best-selling new releases for the
	calendar year&#151;#1
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Call of Duty: Advanced Warfare
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, #3&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Destiny
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, and #5
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Skylanders Trap Team
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Activision's
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Call of Duty: Advanced Warfare
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	was the #1 top-selling console game
	globally for the calendar year. Additionally, in 2014, Call of Duty was the #1&nbsp;franchise in North America for the sixth year in a row.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Activision's
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Destiny
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	was the #1 top-selling new video game IP and the #3 top-selling
	new release in North America and Europe combined for 2014.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Activision's
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Skylanders Trap Team
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	was the #1 top-selling kids console game globally
	for the calendar year. For the third consecutive year, Skylanders was the #1 kids video game franchise of the year in the U.S. and globally.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Product Release Highlights
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Games and digital downloadable content released during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014
	included:
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>

<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=49,EFW="2223239",CP="ACTIVISION BLIZZARD, INC.",DN="1",CHK=87729,FOLIO='49',FILE='DISK108:[15ZAO1.15ZAO15401]DK15401A.;15',USER='JFUSS',CD='26-FEB-2015;13:41' -->
<A NAME="A2223239Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DK15401_1_50">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2223239Z10-K_HTM_BG15401A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	The Amazing Spider-Man
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#153;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	2
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Transformers
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#153;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	: Rise of the Dark
	Spark
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	World of Warcraft: Warlords of Draenor
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#153;
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On
	January&nbsp;11, 2015, Activision launched a public open beta for
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Call of Duty Online
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, a free-to-play game available in China.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On
	January&nbsp;13, 2015, Blizzard began the closed beta test for
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Heroes of the Storm,
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	its upcoming free-to-play online team brawler
	featuring iconic heroes from Blizzard games.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On
	January&nbsp;27, 2015, Activision released
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Call of Duty: Advanced Warfare Havoc
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, the first downloadable content pack for
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Call of Duty: Advanced Warfare
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	on
	certain platforms.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	International Operations
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;International sales are a fundamental part of our business. Net revenues from international sales accounted for approximately 50%, 47%,
	and 50% of our total consolidated net revenues for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, 2013 and 2012, respectively. In addition to our United States ("U.S.") operations, we maintain significant
	operations in Canada, the United Kingdom ("U.K."), France, Germany, Ireland, Italy, Sweden, Spain, the Netherlands, Australia, South Korea and China. An important element of our international strategy
	is to develop content that is specifically directed toward local cultures and customs. Our international business is subject to risks typical of an international business, including, but not limited
	to, foreign currency exchange rate volatility and changes in local economies. Accordingly, our future results could be materially and adversely affected by changes in foreign currency exchange rates
	and changes in local economies.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Management's Overview of Business Trends
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Digital Online Channel Revenues
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We provide our products through both retail and digital distribution channels. Many of our video games that are available through
	retailers as physical "boxed" software products are also available digitally (from our websites and from websites and digital distribution channels owned by third parties). In addition, we offer
	players digital downloadable content as add-ons to our products (
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	e.g.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, new multi-player content packs), generally for a one-time fee. We also offer
	subscription-based services and other value-added services for
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	World of Warcraft
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	and microtransactions for
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Hearthstone
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	:
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Heroes of
	Warcraft
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, all of which are digitally delivered and hosted by Battle.net. We have
	further plans to introduce games based on some of our most successful franchises which operate online on a free-to-play model with microtransactions, including Blizzard's
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Heroes of the Storm
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	and
	Activision's
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Call of Duty Online
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	currently define sales via digital online channels as revenues from subscriptions, licensing royalties, value-added services, downloadable content, and digitally distributed products.
	This definition may differ from that used by our competitors or other companies.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;According
	to Activision Blizzard internal estimates, digital gaming revenues for the interactive entertainment industry for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 increased by
	approximately 28% as compared to the same period in 2013. The primary drivers of the increase in digital gaming revenues for the interactive entertainment industry were increases in consumer purchases
	of full games via digital channels and an increase in mobile gaming revenues. Digital revenues are an important part of our business, and we continue to focus on and develop products, such as
	downloadable content, that can be delivered via digital online channels. The amount of our digital revenues in any period may fluctuate depending, in part, on the timing and nature of our specific
	product releases. Our sales of digital downloadable content are driven in part by sales of, and engagement by players in, our retail products.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	50
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=4,SEQ=50,EFW="2223239",CP="ACTIVISION BLIZZARD, INC.",DN="1",CHK=668048,FOLIO='50',FILE='DISK108:[15ZAO1.15ZAO15401]DK15401A.;15',USER='JFUSS',CD='26-FEB-2015;13:41' -->
<A NAME="A2223239Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DK15401_1_51">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2223239Z10-K_HTM_BG15401A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	As
	such, lower revenues in our retail distribution channels in the current year may impact our digital online channels revenues in the subsequent year.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For
	the year December&nbsp;31, 2014, net revenues through digital online channels increased by $338&nbsp;million, as compared to the same period in 2013, and represented 43% of our
	total consolidated net revenues, as compared to 34% for the same period in 2013. On a non-GAAP basis (which excludes the impact of deferred revenues), net revenues through digital online channels for
	the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 increased by $633&nbsp;million, as compared to the same period in 2013, and represented 46% of our total non-GAAP net revenues, as compared to 36% for the
	same period in 2013.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Please
	refer to the reconciliation between GAAP and non-GAAP financial measures later in this document for further discussions of retail and digital online channels.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Conditions in the Retail Distribution Channels
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Conditions in the retail distribution channels of the interactive entertainment industry continued to be challenging during the year of
	2014. In North America and Europe, retail sales of video games declined by 17%, as compared to the same period in 2013, according to The NPD Group and GfK Chart-Track. The continued shift of video
	game purchases to digital distribution channels has impacted the ongoing decline in retail console software sales.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Further,
	while the new console cycle has started strongly and demand for next-generation games was higher than expected, the demand for prior-generation games declined at a faster pace
	than the growth of sales for next-generation titles, resulting in the overall decline in sales in the retail distribution channels. According to The NPD Group and GfK Chart-Track, retail sales from
	prior-generation platform games declined by 54% for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, as compared to the same period in 2013. However, the increase in digitally distributed games, including
	full-game downloads, add-on content, and free-to-play games, has partially offset the negative trends in the retail distribution channels.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Console Platform Transition
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In November 2013, Sony released the PS4 and Microsoft released the Xbox One, their respective next-generation game consoles and
	entertainment systems. According to The NPD Group and GfK Chart-Track in North America and Europe, as of December&nbsp;31, 2014, the combined installed base of PS4 and Xbox One hardware was
	approximately 24&nbsp;million units, as compared to the combined installed base of PS3 and Xbox&nbsp;360 hardware of approximately 122&nbsp;million units.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;When
	new console platforms are announced or introduced into the market, consumers may reduce their purchases of game console software products for prior-generation console platforms in
	anticipation of new platforms becoming available. During these periods, sales of the game console software products we publish may slow or even decline until new platforms are introduced and achieve
	wide consumer acceptance. In prior cycles, as the next-generation installed base grew, software sales declines abated and software sales grew.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During
	platform transitions, we simultaneously incur costs to develop and market new titles for prior-generation video game platforms, which may not sell at premium prices, and to
	develop and market products for next-generation platforms, which may have a smaller installed base until the next-generation platforms achieve wide consumer acceptance. We continually monitor console
	hardware sales and manage our product delivery on each of the prior- and next-generation platforms in a manner we believe to be most effective to maximize our revenue opportunities and achieve the
	desired return on our investments in product development. In the long term, we expect the next-generation consoles to drive industry growth and expand our opportunities.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	51
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=5,SEQ=51,EFW="2223239",CP="ACTIVISION BLIZZARD, INC.",DN="1",CHK=150471,FOLIO='51',FILE='DISK108:[15ZAO1.15ZAO15401]DK15401A.;15',USER='JFUSS',CD='26-FEB-2015;13:41' -->
<A NAME="A2223239Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DK15401_1_52">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2223239Z10-K_HTM_BG15401A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Concentration of Top Titles
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The concentration of retail revenues among key titles has continued as a trend in the overall interactive software industry. According
	to The NPD Group, the top 10 titles accounted for 32% of the sales in the U.S. interactive entertainment industry in 2014. Similarly, a significant portion of our revenues has historically been
	derived from video games based on a few popular franchises and these video games are responsible for a disproportionately high percentage of our profits. For example, our three largest franchises in
	2014&#151;Call of Duty, World of Warcraft, and Skylanders&#151;accounted for approximately 67% of our net revenues, and a significantly higher percentage of our operating income, for the
	year.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	are continually exploring additional investments in existing and future franchises. We launched Destiny and Hearthstone: Heroes of Warcraft in 2014 and expect to expand our leading
	franchise portfolio in the future. In early 2015, we released
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Call of Duty Online
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	into open beta in China, and we released
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Heroes of the Storm
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	into closed
	beta. While we plan to continue to diversify our portfolio of key franchises, we expect that a limited number of popular
	franchises will continue to produce a disproportionately high percentage of our, and the industry's, revenues and profits in the near future.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Seasonality
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The interactive entertainment industry is highly seasonal. We have historically experienced our highest sales volume in the year-end
	holiday buying season, which occurs in the fourth quarter. We defer the recognition of a significant amount of net revenues, related to our software titles containing online functionality that
	constitutes a more-than-inconsequential separate service deliverable, over an extended period of time (
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	i.e.,
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;typically five months to less than a
	year). As a result, the quarter in which we generate the highest sales volume may be different than the quarter in which we recognize the highest amount of net revenues. Our results can also vary
	based on a number of factors including, but not limited to, title release date, consumer demand, market conditions and shipment schedules.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Outlook
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Although we believe our strong product lineup in 2015 positions us for long-term growth, we expect our results in 2015 to be lower than
	in 2014, primarily due to the significant weakening of foreign currencies versus the U.S. dollar and a higher expected tax rate, as
	well as, to a lesser extent, product slate differences such as a lighter Blizzard slate, investments in infrastructure and scaling of new properties with the free-to-play business model.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	January 2015, two of our new free-to-play games were released into beta testing. On January&nbsp;11, 2015, Activision launched a public open beta for
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Call of
	Duty Online
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	available in China. On January&nbsp;13, 2015, Blizzard began closed beta testing for
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Heroes of the Storm,
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	its
	upcoming free-to-play online team brawler featuring iconic heroes from Blizzard games. As with other free-to-play games, we expect these titles to build their audiences and increase engagement and
	monetization gradually over time.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	addition, Activision plans to follow-up on the 2014 release of
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Destiny
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	with an expansion pack in the second quarter of 2015 and
	additional content in the second half of 2015. Also, in the fourth quarter of 2015, Activision plans to release a new Call of Duty game from Treyarch, the developer of the highly successful
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Call of Duty: Black
	Ops
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	series, and a new Skylanders game. Blizzard plans to release additional content for Hearthstone: Heroes of Warcraft, as well as
	release the game on a wider range of mobile devices later in 2015. Lastly, Blizzard expects to begin beta testing in 2015 for both
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Overwatch
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#153;, a new multi-player game set in an all-new Blizzard
	game universe, and
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	StarCraft II: Legacy of the
	Void
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#153;, a standalone game experience that concludes the StarCraft II trilogy.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
	a result of the significant weakening of foreign currencies versus the U.S. dollar, the company's 2015 international revenues and earnings are expected to be translated at much lower
	rates than in
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	52
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	2014.
	This impacts the Company's 2015 outlook as compared to 2014 actual results given approximately 50% of the company's revenues, and a higher percentage of profits, are generated outside the U.S.
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Operating Segment Results
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our operating segments are consistent with our internal organizational structure, the manner in which our operations are reviewed and
	managed by our Chief Executive Officer, who is our Chief Operating Decision Maker ("CODM"), the manner in which we assess operating performance and allocate resources, and the availability of separate
	financial information. We do not aggregate operating segments.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	CODM reviews segment performance exclusive of the impact of the change in deferred revenues and related cost of sales with respect to certain of our online-enabled games, stock-based
	compensation expense, amortization of intangible assets as a result of purchase price accounting, and fees and other expenses (including legal fees, costs, expenses and accruals) related to the
	Purchase Transaction and related debt financings. The CODM does not review any information regarding total assets on an operating segment basis, and accordingly, no disclosure is made with respect
	thereto. Information on the operating segments and reconciliations of total net revenues and total segment operating income to consolidated net revenues from external customers and consolidated income
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	53
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>

<FONT SIZE=2>
	before
	income tax expense for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, 2013, and 2012 are presented in the table below (amounts in millions):

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For
	a better understanding of the differences in presentation between our segment results and the consolidated results, the following explains the nature of each reconciling item.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Net Effect from Deferral of Net Revenues and Related Cost of Sales
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We have determined that some of our titles' online functionality represents an essential component of gameplay and as a result,
	represents a more-than-inconsequential separate deliverable. As such, we are required to recognize revenues from these titles over the estimated service periods, which range from five months to less
	than one year. The related costs of sales are deferred and recognized when the related revenues are recognized. In the operating segment results table, we present the amount of net revenues and
	related costs of sales separately for each period as a result of this accounting treatment.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	54
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

<!-- THIS IS THE END OF A COMPOSITION COMPONENT -->
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2223239Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DM15401_1_55">
</A>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_BASECOLOR,"BLACK" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DEFAULTFONT,"FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TABLESHADECOLOR,"#CCEEFF" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_STABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID #000000 1.0PT;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DTABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:DOUBLE #000000 2.25PT;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_SCRTABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID #000000 1.0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DCRTABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:DOUBLE #000000 2.25PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;" -->
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2223239Z10-K_HTM_BG15401A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Stock-Based Compensation Expense
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We expense our stock-based awards using the grant date fair value over the vesting periods of the stock awards. In the case of
	liability awards, the liability is subject to revaluation based on the stock price at the end of the relevant period. Included within this stock-based compensation are the net effects of
	capitalization, deferral, and amortization.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Amortization of Intangible Assets
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The majority of our intangible assets are the result of the Business Combination and other acquisitions. We amortize the intangible
	assets over their estimated useful lives based on the pattern of consumption of the underlying economic benefits. The amount presented in the
	table represents the effect of the amortization of intangible assets as well as other purchase price accounting adjustments, where applicable, in our consolidated statements of operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Fees and Other Expenses Related to the Purchase Transaction and Related Debt Financings
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We incurred fees and other expenses, such as legal, banking and professional services fees, related to the Purchase Transaction and
	related debt financings. Such expenses are not reviewed by the CODM as part of segment performance.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Segment Net Revenues
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
<U>
	Activision
</U>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Activision's
	net revenues decreased for 2014, as compared to 2013, primarily due to lower revenues from the Call of Duty and Skylanders franchises, partially
	offset by higher revenues from the release of
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Destiny
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	and its first expansion pack
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	The Dark Below
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	in
	2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Activision's
	net revenues decreased for 2013, as compared to 2012, primarily due to lower launch revenues from
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Call of Duty: Ghosts
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	in the
	fourth quarter of 2013 as compared to launch revenues from
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Call of Duty: Black Ops II
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	in the fourth quarter of 2012, lower revenues from our value
	business due to its more focused slate of titles, and lower revenues from the Skylanders franchise. These decreases were partially offset by higher revenues from digital downloadable content from
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Call of Duty: Black
	Ops&nbsp;II
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	as compared to the performance of downloadable content packs from
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Call of Duty: Modern
	Warfare&nbsp;3.
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
<U>
	Blizzard
</U>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Blizzard's
	net revenues increased for 2014, as compared to 2013, primarily due to revenues from
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Diablo III: Reaper of
	Souls,
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	which was released in March 2014 on the PC, and
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Diablo III: Reaper of Souls&#151;Ultimate Evil Edition,
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	which was
	released in August 2014 on certain consoles, revenue from value-added services as a result of the launch of the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	World of Warcraft
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	paid character boost,
	revenues from
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	World of Warcraft: Warlords of Draenor
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, which was released in November 2014, and revenues from
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Hearthstone: Heroes
	of Warcraft,
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	which was commercially released in 2014, as compared to revenues in 2013 from
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	StarCraft II: Heart of the
	Swarm
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&reg;, which was released in March 2013, and from
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Diablo III
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	on consoles, which was released in September 2013.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	55
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=55,EFW="2223239",CP="ACTIVISION BLIZZARD, INC.",DN="1",CHK=271408,FOLIO='55',FILE='DISK108:[15ZAO1.15ZAO15401]DM15401A.;12',USER='ABEAULI',CD='26-FEB-2015;13:36' -->
<A NAME="A2223239Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DM15401_1_56">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2223239Z10-K_HTM_BG15401A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;At
	December&nbsp;31, 2014, the global subscriber* base for World of Warcraft was over 10&nbsp;million, compared to approximately 7.4&nbsp;million subscribers at
	September&nbsp;30, 2014, and approximately 7.8&nbsp;million subscribers at December&nbsp;31, 2013. The increase as compared to September&nbsp;30, 2014 and December&nbsp;31, 2013 was
	proportional to the mix of subscribers in the East and the West and is driven by the launch of the new expansion,
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	World of Warcraft: Warlords of Draenor
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	in November 2014. In general, the average revenue per subscriber is lower in the East than in the West (where the "East" includes China, Taiwan, and South Korea, and the "West" includes North America,
	Europe, Australia, and Latin America). As we have seen following past expansion releases, we expect downward pressure on the number of subscribers in 2015. Going forward, Blizzard expects to continue
	delivering new game content in all regions that is intended to further appeal to the gaming community.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Blizzard's
	net revenues decreased for 2013, as compared to 2012, primarily due to the release of
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Diablo III
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	in May 2012, without a
	comparable release in 2013, lower revenues from the World of Warcraft franchise, and the release
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	World of Warcraft: Mists of Pandaria&reg;
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	in
	September 2012, without a comparable release in 2013. The decreases were partially offset by the release of
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	StarCraft II: Heart of the Swarm
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	in March
	2013, the release of
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Diablo III
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	for the PS3 and Xbox&nbsp;360 in September 2013, and revenues from
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Hearthstone: Heroes of
	Warcraft
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	during its closed beta in late 2013.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
<U>
	Distribution
</U>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Distribution's
	net revenues increased in 2014, as compared to 2013, primarily due to revenues from the distribution of next-generation hardware, which was
	introduced in the fourth quarter of 2013.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Distribution's
	net revenues increased in 2013, as compared to 2012, primarily due to revenues from the distribution of newly introduced next-generation hardware in late 2013.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Segment Income from Operations
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
<U>
	Activision
</U>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Activision's
	operating income decreased in 2014, as compared to 2013, primarily due to lower revenues, as described above, relatively higher cost of
	sales&#151;software royalties and amortization, and higher sales and marketing activities from the release of
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Destiny
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	; partially offset by lower
	cost of sales&#151;product costs as a result of lower revenues, and lower general and administrative costs, primarily resulting from lower legal-related expenses (including legal-related
	accruals, settlements and fees).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Activision's
	operating income in 2013 was comparable to 2012, despite lower revenues. This was primarily due to the strength of the higher margin digital business associated with
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Call of Duty: Black Ops II
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	digital
	downloadable content, a smaller but more profitable slate of releases from our value business, and lower general and
	administrative costs, primarily resulting from lower legal-related expenses (including legal-related accruals, settlements and fees), partially offset by higher sales and marketing activities to
	support the Call of Duty and Skylanders franchises.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
<U>
	Blizzard
</U>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Blizzard's
	operating income increased in 2014, as compared to 2013, primarily due to higher revenues, as described above, partially offset by higher cost of
	sales&#151;product costs, higher product
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;LINE-HEIGHT:1PT;MARGIN-LEFT:18PT;">
<FONT>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<!-- BLANK LINE TO FORCE PARA -->
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="26%" ALIGN="LEFT">
</FONT>
</P>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	*
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	World of Warcraft
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	subscribers include individuals who have paid a subscription fee or have an active prepaid
	card to play
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	World of Warcraft
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, as well as those who have purchased the game and are within their free month of access. Internet Game Room players who
	have accessed the game over the last thirty days are also counted as subscribers. The above definition excludes all players under free promotional subscriptions, expired or cancelled subscriptions,
	and expired prepaid cards. Subscribers in licensees' territories are defined along the same rules.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	56
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=56,EFW="2223239",CP="ACTIVISION BLIZZARD, INC.",DN="1",CHK=563583,FOLIO='56',FILE='DISK108:[15ZAO1.15ZAO15401]DM15401A.;12',USER='ABEAULI',CD='26-FEB-2015;13:36' -->
<A NAME="A2223239Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DM15401_1_57">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2223239Z10-K_HTM_BG15401A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	development
	costs and sales and marketing activities to support a higher number of titles released in 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Blizzard's
	operating income decreased in 2013, as compared to 2012, primarily due to lower revenues and less capitalization of product development costs, partially offset by lower sales
	and marketing costs as a result of a lower number of titles released in 2013 and lower general and administrative costs from lower accrued bonuses based on its 2013 financial performance.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Non-GAAP Financial Measures
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The analysis of revenues by distribution channel is presented both on a GAAP (including the impact from the change in deferred
	revenues) and non-GAAP (excluding the impact from the change in deferred revenues) basis. We use this non-GAAP measure internally when evaluating our operating performance, when planning, forecasting
	and analyzing future periods, and when assessing the performance of our management team. We believe this is appropriate because this non-GAAP measure enables an analysis of performance based on the
	timing of actual transactions with our customers, which is consistent with the way the Company is measured by investment analysts and industry data sources, and facilitates comparison of operating
	performance between periods. In addition, excluding the impact from the change in deferred net revenue provides a much more timely indication of trends in our sales and other operating results. While
	we believe that this non-GAAP measure is useful in evaluating our business, this information should be considered as supplemental in nature and is not meant to be considered in isolation from, as a
	substitute for, or as more important than, the related financial information prepared in accordance with GAAP. In addition, this non-GAAP financial measure may not be the same as any non-GAAP measure
	presented by another company. This non-GAAP financial measure has limitations in that it does not reflect all of the items associated with our GAAP revenues. We compensate for the limitations
	resulting from the exclusion of the change in deferred revenues by considering the impact of that item separately and by considering our GAAP, as well as non-GAAP, revenues.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	57
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

</P>

</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(1)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We
	define revenues from digital online channels as revenues from subscriptions and memberships, licensing royalties, value-added services, downloadable
	content, and digitally distributed products.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(2)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We
	have determined that some of our titles' online functionality represents an essential component of gameplay and as a result, represents a more-than
	inconsequential separate deliverable. As such, we recognize revenues attributed to these titles over the estimated service periods, which range from five months to less than one year. In the table
	above, we present the amount of net revenues for each period as a result of this accounting treatment.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(3)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Total
	non-GAAP net revenues presented also represents our total operating segment net revenues.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	decrease in GAAP net revenues from retail channels for 2014, as compared to 2013, was primarily due to lower revenues from the Call of Duty and Skylanders franchises. The decreases
	were partially offset by revenues from
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Destiny
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, which was released in September 2014, and revenues from
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Diablo III: Reaper of
	Souls,
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	which was released in March 2014 on the PC, and
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Diablo III: Reaper of Souls&#151;Ultimate Evil Edition
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, which was
	released in August 2014 on certain consoles.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	decrease in GAAP net revenues from retail channels for 2013, as compared to 2012, was primarily due to lower revenues from
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Diablo III
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	for the PC, which was released in May 2012, lower revenues from our value business due to its more focused slate of titles, lower revenues from the
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	58
</FONT>
</P>

</A>

</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	launch
	of
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Call of Duty: Ghosts
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	as compared to the launch of
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Call of Duty: Black Ops II
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, which was
	released in November 2012, and lower revenues from our Skylanders franchise. The decreases were partially offset by revenues from the release of
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Diablo
	III
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	for the PS3 and Xbox&nbsp;360 in September 2013, revenues from
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	StarCraft II: Heart of the Swarm
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, which was released in
	March 2013, and the recognition of previously deferred revenues from
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	World of Warcraft: Mists of Pandaria
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, which was released in September 2012.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	increase in GAAP net revenues from digital online channels for 2014, as compared to 2013, was primarily due to higher revenues from
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Hearthstone: Heroes of
	Warcraft,
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	value-added services revenues from the launch of the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	World of Warcraft
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	paid character boost, revenues from
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	World of Warcraft: Warlords of
	Draenor
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, revenues from
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Diablo III: Reaper of Souls,
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	which was released in
	March 2014 on the PC, and
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Diablo III: Reaper of Souls&#151;Ultimate Evil Edition
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, which was released in August 2014 on certain consoles, and the
	release of
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Destiny
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	and its first expansion pack
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	The Dark Below,
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	and higher digital download revenues
	from
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Call of Duty: Advanced Warfare
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	. The increases were partially offset by lower revenues recognized from
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	StarCraft II: Heart
	of the Swarm
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, which was released in March 2013, lower revenues recognized from
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	World of Warcraft: Mists of Pandaria
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, which was
	released in September 2012, and lower downloadable content revenues from the Call of Duty franchise.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	increase in GAAP net revenues from digital online channels for 2013, as compared to 2012, was primarily due to revenues from the 2013 releases of
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Call of
	Duty: Black Ops II
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	digital downloadable content, as compared to the 2012 releases of
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	downloadable
	content packs, stronger revenues from
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Call of Duty: Black Ops II
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, as compared to
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Call of Duty: Modern Warfare
	3
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, recognition of previously deferred revenues from
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	World of Warcraft: Mists of Pandaria
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, and revenues from
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	StarCraft II: Heart of the
	Swarm
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, which was released in March 2013. The increases were partially offset by lower revenues from
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Diablo III
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	for the PC, which was released in May 2012, lower subscription and
	value-added services revenues from the World of Warcraft franchise due to
	a lower number of subscribers as compared to same period in 2012, and lower revenues from our Call of Duty catalog titles.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	decrease in non-GAAP net revenues from retail channels for 2014, as compared to 2013, was primarily due to lower revenues from the Call of Duty and Skylanders franchises. The
	decreases were partially offset by revenues from
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Destiny
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, which was released in September 2014, and revenues from
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Diablo III:
	Reaper of Souls,
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	which was released in March 2014 on the PC and
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Diablo III: Reaper of Souls&#151;Ultimate Evil Edition
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	,
	which was released in August 2014 on certain consoles as compared to revenues from the September 2013 release of
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Diablo III
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	on the PS3 and
	Xbox&nbsp;360.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	decrease in non-GAAP net revenues from retail channels for 2013, as compared to 2012, was primarily due to lower revenues from
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Diablo
	III
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	for the PC, which was released in May 2012, lower revenues from
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Call of Duty: Ghosts
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	in 2013 as compared to revenues in 2012
	for
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Call of Duty: Black
	Ops II,
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	fewer releases from our value business due to its more focused slate of titles, lower revenues from our Skylanders franchise and Call of Duty catalog titles, and lower
	sales from
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	World of Warcraft: Mists of Pandaria
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, which was released in September 2012. The decreases were partially offset by revenues from
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Diablo III
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	for
	the PS3 and Xbox360, which was released in September 2013, as well as the sales from
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	StarCraft II: Heart of the
	Swarm
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, which was released in March 2013.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	increase in non-GAAP net revenues from digital online channels for 2014, as compared to 2013, was primarily due to revenues from
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Hearthstone: Heroes of
	Warcraft,
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	value-added services revenues from the launch of the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	World of Warcraft: Warlords of Draenor
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	paid character boost,
	revenues from
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	World of Warcraft: Warlords of Draenor
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, revenues from
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Diablo III: Reaper of Souls,
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	which
	was released in March 2014 on the PC, and
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Diablo III: Reaper of Souls&#151;Ultimate Evil Edition
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, which was released in August 2014 on certain
	consoles, revenues from the release of
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Destiny
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	and its first expansion pack
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	The Dark Below,
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	and higher
	digital downloads of
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Call of Duty: Advanced Warfare
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	. The increases were partially offset by lower downloadable content revenues from the Call of Duty
	franchise.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	59
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=5,SEQ=59,EFW="2223239",CP="ACTIVISION BLIZZARD, INC.",DN="1",CHK=480121,FOLIO='59',FILE='DISK108:[15ZAO1.15ZAO15401]DM15401A.;12',USER='ABEAULI',CD='26-FEB-2015;13:36' -->
<A NAME="A2223239Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DM15401_1_60">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2223239Z10-K_HTM_BG15401A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	decrease in non-GAAP net revenues from digital online channels for 2013, as compared to 2012, was primarily due to lower revenues from
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Diablo
	III
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	for the PC, which was released in May 2012, lower subscription and value-added services revenues from the World of Warcraft franchise due to a lower number of subscribers
	as compared to 2012, and lower revenues from
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	World of Warcraft: Mists of Pandaria,
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	which was released in September 2012. The decreases were partially
	offset by stronger revenues from the 2013 releases of
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Call of Duty: Black Ops II
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	digital downloadable content, as compared to 2012 releases of
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Call of Duty: Modern Warfare
	3
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	downloadable content packs, stronger catalog sales of
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Call of Duty: Black Ops
	II
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	in 2013, as compared to catalog sales of
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	in 2012, and revenues from
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	StarCraft II: Heart of the Swarm
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, which was released in 2013.
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_11"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>

</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">

</P>

<FONT SIZE=2>
	Total impact on consolidated net revenues
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">

</TD>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Consolidated
	net revenues in all regions decreased in 2014 as compared to 2013, except for the Asia Pacific region. As previously discussed, the decrease in the Company's consolidated
	net revenues in 2014, as compared to the same period in 2013, was mainly due to lower revenues from Call of Duty and Skylanders franchises, lower revenues recognized from
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	StarCraft II: Heart of the Swarm
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, which was released in March 2013, and lower revenues recognized from
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	World of Warcraft: Mists
	of Pandaria
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, which was released in September 2012. The decreases were partially offset by the launch of
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Destiny
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	and its first
	expansion pack
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	The Dark Below
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, revenues from
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Hearthstone: Heroes of Warcraft,
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	value-added services
	revenues from the launch of the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	World of Warcraft
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	paid character boost, revenues from
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	World of Warcraft: Warlords of
	Draenor
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, and revenues from
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Diablo III: Reaper of Souls,
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	which was released in March 2014 on the PC, and
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Diablo III: Reaper of Souls&#151;Ultimate Evil
	Edition
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, which was released in August 2014 on certain consoles. All of the above factors impact
	our year-over-year comparisons for
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	60
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=6,SEQ=60,EFW="2223239",CP="ACTIVISION BLIZZARD, INC.",DN="1",CHK=383281,FOLIO='60',FILE='DISK108:[15ZAO1.15ZAO15401]DM15401A.;12',USER='ABEAULI',CD='26-FEB-2015;13:36' -->
<A NAME="A2223239Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DM15401_1_61">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2223239Z10-K_HTM_BG15401A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	North
	America and Europe. Further, in the Europe region, the decreases were partially offset by the increase in Distribution segment revenues. In the Asia Pacific region, the higher mix of Blizzard
	segment operations, as compared to Publishing segment operations, resulted in a year-over-year increase of revenues.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	all regions, the decrease in deferred revenues recognized in 2014, as compared to the same period in 2013, was primarily attributed to the higher deferral of revenues from
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	World of Warcraft: Warlords of Draenor
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, which was released in November 2014, as compared to the recognition of revenues from
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	World of Warcraft: Mists of Pandaria
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, which was released in September 2012, deferral of revenues from
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Destiny
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	and its first expansion pack
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	The Dark Below
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, both of which were released in 2014, and the
	deferral of revenues from
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Hearthstone: Heroes of Warcraft
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, which was also released in 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Consolidated
	net revenues in all regions decreased in 2013 as compared to 2012. As previously discussed, the decrease in the Company's consolidated net revenues in 2013, as compared to
	the same period in 2012, was mainly due to lower revenues from
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Diablo III
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	for the PC, which was released in May 2012, lower revenues from our Skylanders
	franchise, lower revenues from the launch of
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Call of Duty: Ghosts
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	as compared to the launch of
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Call of Duty: Black Ops
	II
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, and fewer releases from our value business due to its more focused slate of titles. In the Asia Pacific region, net revenues were
	further impacted by lower
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	World of Warcraft
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	revenues resulting from a lower number of subscribers. In all regions, the decreases were partially offset
	by a stronger performance from
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Call of Duty: Black Ops&nbsp;II
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	digital downloadable content, as compared to
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Call of Duty:
	Modern Warfare 3
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	downloadable content packs, recognition of previously deferred revenues from
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Call of Duty: Black Ops II,
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	and
	revenues from
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	StarCraft II: Heart of the Swarm
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, which was released in 2013. The decreases in North America and Europe were also partially offset by the
	recognition of previously deferred revenues from
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	World of Warcraft: Mists of Pandaria
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	all regions, the increase in deferred revenues recognized in 2013, as compared to the same period in 2012, was primarily attributed to the lower deferral of revenues from
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Call of Duty: Ghosts,
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	which was
	released in November 2013, as compared to the deferral of revenues for
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Call of Duty: Black Ops
	II
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, which was released in November 2012, and recognition of previously deferred revenues from
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Call of Duty: Black Ops II
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, which
	was released in November 2012, and
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	World of Warcraft: Mists of Pandaria
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, which was released in September 2012. This increase was partially offset by the
	higher deferral of revenues from stronger catalog sales of
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Call of Duty: Black Ops II
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	in 2013, as compared to catalog sales of
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	in 2012, and the deferral of revenues from
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Diablo III
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	on the PS3 and
	Xbox&nbsp;360, which was released in September 2013, and
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Call of Duty: Black Ops II
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	digital downloadable content released in 2013.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Foreign Exchange Impact
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Changes in foreign exchange rates had a negative impact of $2&nbsp;million, a positive impact of $33&nbsp;million, and a negative
	impact of $114&nbsp;million on Activision Blizzard's consolidated net revenues in 2014, 2013, and 2012, respectively, as compared to the same periods in the previous year. The changes are primarily
	due to changes in the value of the U.S. dollar relative to the euro and British pound.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For
	the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, given that a significant portion of the Company's GAAP net consolidated revenues is generated in the first half of the fiscal year due to the
	impact of deferrals, where the euro and British pound strengthened against the U.S dollar as compared to the same period in 2013, the negative impact from the significant weakening of the euro and
	British pound relative to U.S. dollar in the later stages of 2014 was largely offset in the Company's consolidated net revenues for the full year 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	61
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=7,SEQ=61,EFW="2223239",CP="ACTIVISION BLIZZARD, INC.",DN="1",CHK=151438,FOLIO='61',FILE='DISK108:[15ZAO1.15ZAO15401]DM15401A.;12',USER='ABEAULI',CD='26-FEB-2015;13:36' -->
<A NAME="A2223239Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DM15401_1_62">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2223239Z10-K_HTM_BG15401A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_13"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>

<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->

</I>
</FONT>
</P>

	December&nbsp;31, 2014, 2013, and 2012 (amounts in millions):

</P>

</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:0.75PT;FONT-SIZE:0.75PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>

	&#8203;
